gw.api.system

Class ParameterKey<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.system.ParameterKey<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanParameterKey, DateParameterKey, DoubleParameterKey, EnumParameterKey, IntegerParameterKey, ListParameterKey, SetParameterKey, StringParameterKey, TimeParameterKey

    public abstract class ParameterKey<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Description/specification of a configuration parameter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParameterKey

        public ParameterKey(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ParameterKey> keyMap,
                    java.lang.String tag,
                    boolean localOk,
                    T defaultValue,
                    ParameterKey dependsOn,
                    boolean required)
        Creates parameter key.
        Parameters:
        keyMap - map of parameters.
        tag - parameter name in the config.xml.
        localOk - true if the value can be overriden for particular server or environment.
        defaultValue - optional default value.
        dependsOn - optional reference to the parameter this one depends on.
        required - true if the value is required to for an application to start.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the parameter in config.xml.
        Returns:
        name of the parameter.

      • getDefault

        public T getDefault()
        Get the default value for the parameter.
        Returns:
        default value of the parameter, may be null. This is only used in tests. You're probably looking for getDefaultConstant(). Note also that _defaultValueKey IS used by production code. This stuff really needs a scrubbing down though.

      • getDefaultConstant

        public T getDefaultConstant()
        Get the default constant value if specified.
        Returns:
        default constant value of the parameter, may be null.

      • isLocalOk

        public boolean isLocalOk()
        Whether this parameter is "localizable", i.e. its value can be overriden for particular server or environment.
        Returns:
        true if the value can be overriden for particular server or environment.

        Whether this parameter is "nullable". Note that this attribute is to be removed sometime in the future because it is redundant and not orthogonal to isRequired().
        Returns:
        true if this parameter is "nullable".
